alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 4:59PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Yuma and western Dundy Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 459 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Wray, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Yuma and western Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Laird, Alvin and Vernon. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 233 and 250. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado...and southwestern Nebraska.
